casebody.data:
ANTONIA AMBROSE, ADMINISTRATRIX OF THE ESTATE OF JOHN AMBROSE, Sr., DECEASED, RESPONDENT, v. NEW YORK CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY, APPELLANT. Argued October 24, 1928 Decided February 4, 1929. For the appellant, Wall, Haight, Carey & Hartpence. For the respondent, Alexander Simipson.

This was a suit in the Hudson County Circuit Court in an action at law to recover damages for the death of the plaintiff’s decedent, which was caused by the happening of an accident. Plaintiff had judgment, and defendant appeals to this court.

Pee Curiam.

The judgment under review herein is affirmed by an equally divided court.

For affirmance — -Trenohard, Katzenbach, Lloyd, Van Buskirk, McG-lennon, Dear, JJ. 6.

For reversal — The Chancellor, Chief Justice, Parker, Campbell, Kays, Heteield, JJ. 6.
